This is a testharness.js-based test.
[PRECONDITION_FAILED] MediaRecorder will stop recording and fire a stop event when all tracks are ended
  "video/mp4;codecs=avc1,mp4a.40.2" for MediaRecorder is not supported
[PRECONDITION_FAILED] MediaRecorder will stop recording and fire a stop event when stop() is called
  "video/mp4;codecs=avc1,mp4a.40.2" for MediaRecorder is not supported
[PRECONDITION_FAILED] MediaRecorder will not fire an exception when stopped after creation
  "video/mp4;codecs=avc1,mp4a.40.2" for MediaRecorder is not supported
[PRECONDITION_FAILED] MediaRecorder will not fire an exception when stopped after having just been stopped
  "video/mp4;codecs=avc1,mp4a.40.2" for MediaRecorder is not supported
[PRECONDITION_FAILED] MediaRecorder will not fire an exception when stopped after having just been spontaneously stopped
  "video/mp4;codecs=avc1,mp4a.40.2" for MediaRecorder is not supported
[PRECONDITION_FAILED] MediaRecorder will fire start event even if stopped synchronously
  "video/mp4;codecs=avc1,mp4a.40.2" for MediaRecorder is not supported
[PRECONDITION_FAILED] MediaRecorder will fire start event even if a track is removed synchronously
  "video/mp4;codecs=avc1,mp4a.40.2" for MediaRecorder is not supported
[PRECONDITION_FAILED] MediaRecorder will fire only start and stop events in a basic recording flow.
  "video/mp4;codecs=avc1,mp4a.40.2" for MediaRecorder is not supported
Harness: the test ran to completion.
